Judy wrote to me:
> The Heritrix 9host crawl stopped due to out of memory errors.  There's a 
> log where you can see all the generated output:
> 
> /0/crawls/heritrix/9host/log.txt

I see that the 'startcrawl' script in the directory did not specify a 
larger than default maximum heap-size for the Java VM than the default. 

This means that even though crawl09 may have 2GB RAM, the JVM is only
going to use a small fraction of that before it imposes its own ceiling
on memory use -- and starts giving OutOfMemory errors to running apps
that require more memory than that low ceiling.

The "-Xmx" VM command-line parameter can set a higher ceiling. I'd
suggest "-Xmx1664m" -- 1664MB -- as being ~75% of the machines total
RAM. 

Another note: we probably don't want full "INFO" logging on these
test runs; WARNING should be plenty for everything except the 
named crawl logs (uri-processing, crawl-errors, etc.). 

So this implies using the "-DDjava.util.logging.config.file=[filename]" 
option to set a logging-properties file, and having entries in that file 
which fine-tune the amount of detail logged.

Here's the logging.properties settings I'd recommend:

==[ logging.properties ]==
# set catchall handler that doesn't filter
handlers= java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler
java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.level= ALL

# set default global logging level
.level= WARNING

# enable the named-logs at "INFO" level
uri-processing.level= INFO
crawl-errors.level= INFO
uri-errors.level= INFO
progress-statistics.level = INFO

# HTTPClient has a alot of superfluous WARNING logging
# uncomment this to turn all but the most important off
# org.apache.commons.httpclient.level= SEVERE
==[ end logging.properties ]==

- Gordon
